    • bettr

Launch bettr app to explore and aggregate performance metrics

bettr.Rd

Launch bettr app to explore and aggregate performance metrics

bettr(
  df,
  idCol = "Method",
  metrics_num = setdiff(colnames(df), idCol),
  metrics_cat = c(),
  initialWeights = NULL,
  initialFlips = NULL,
  initialOffsets = NULL,
  initialTransforms = NULL,
  initialCuts = NULL,
  metricGroups = list(),
  bstheme = "darkly"
)

Arguments

df

A data.frame in wide format.
idCol

Character scalar, indicating which column of df that contains IDs of the entities to be compared (e.g., methods).
metrics_num, metrics_cat

Character vectors, indicating which of the columns of df that correspond to, numeric and categorical, respectively, metrics of interest.
initialWeights

Named numeric vector providing initial weights for aggregating the metric scores. Must have one entry per metric included in df.
initialFlips, initialOffsets, initialTransforms

Named vectors giving the initial value of the flip, offset and transforms for each metric.
initialCuts

Named list giving the initial values of cut points used to make each metric categorical.
metricGroups

Named list of named character vectors. Each list entry corresponds to one grouping of metrics. The grouping much be a named vector indicating the respective group for each metric.
bstheme

Character scalar giving the bootswatch theme for the app (see https://bootswatch.com/). Default 'darkly'.

Author

Charlotte Soneson
